meanings.definition: To renounce or relinquish a throne, power, responsibility, or right.
meanings.sent1: The king abdicated his crown to his son.
meanings.sent2: She abdicated her role as team captain.
meanings.sent3: The cat abdicated its duty to catch the mouse, opting to nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The CEO abdicated his power, leaving chaos in the company.
meanings.sent5: The student abdicated the responsibility of studying, leading to poor grades.

meanings.definition: To fail to fulfill or undertake a responsibility or duty.
meanings.sent1: He abdicated his promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: The politician abdicated his duty to serve the people.
meanings.sent3: The dog abdicated its duty to guard the house, choosing to chase squirrels instead.
meanings.sent4: The employee abdicated their responsibility, causing delays in the project.
meanings.sent5: She abdicated her role as mediator, resulting in a heated argument.
